section.title: Lua API
section.para:
To access the darktable specific functions you must load the darktable environement:
darktable = require "darktable"
All functions and data are accessed through the darktable module.
This documentation for API version 1.1.0-dev.

section.title: darktable
section.para: The darktable library is the main entry point for all access to the darktable internals.

section.title: darktable.print
section.para: Will print a string to the darktable control log (the long overlayed window that appears over the main panel).

listitem.para: The string to display which should be a single line.

section.title: darktable.print_error
section.para: This function will print its parameter if the Lua logdomain is activated. Start darktable with the "-d lua" command line option to enable the Lua logdomain.

section.title: darktable.register_event
section.para: This function registers a callback to be called when a given event happens.
Events are documented in the event section.

listitem.para: The name of the event to register to.
The function to call on event. The signature of the function depends on the type of event.
Some events need extra parameters at registration time; these must be specified here.

section.title: darktable.register_storage
section.synopsis: function( plugin_name : string, name : string, [store : function], [finalize : function], [supported : function], [initialize : function] )
section.para: This function will add a new storage implemented in Lua.
A storage is a module that is responsible for handling images once they have been generated during export. Examples of core storages include filesystem, e-mail, facebook...

listitem.para: A Unique name for the plugin.
A human readable name for the plugin.

listitem.synopsis: function( storage : types.dt_imageio_module_storage_t, image : types.dt_lua_image_t, format : types.dt_imageio_module_format_t, filename : string, number : integer, total : integer, high_quality : boolean, extra_data : table )
listitem.para: This function is called once for each exported image. Images can be exported in parallel but the calls to this function will be serialized.
The storage object used for the export.
The format object used for the export.
The name of a temporary file where the processed image is stored.
The number of the image out of the export series.
The total number of images in the export series.
True if the export is high quality.
An empty Lua table to take extra data. This table is common to the initialize, store and finalize calls in an export serie.
This function is called once all images are processed and all store calls are finished.
The storage object used for the export.
A table keyed by the exported image objects and valued with the corresponding temporary export filename.
An empty Lua table to store extra data. This table is common to all calls to store and the call to finalize in a given export series.
A function called to check if a given image format is supported by the Lua storage; this is used to build the dropdown format list for the GUI.
Note that the parameters in the format are the ones currently set in the GUI; the user might change them before export.
The format object to report about.
True if the corresponding format is supported.

listitem.synopsis: function( storage : types.dt_imageio_module_storage_t, format : types.dt_imageio_module_format_t, images : table of types.dt_lua_image_t, high_quality : boolean, extra_data : table ) : table or nil
listitem.para: A function called before storage happens
This function can change the list of exported functions
The format object to report about.
A table containing images to be exported.
True if the export is high quality.
An empty Lua table to take extra data. This table is common to the initialize, store and finalize calls in an export serie.
The modified table of images to export or nil
If nil (or nothing) is returned, the original list of images will be exported
If a table of images is returned, that table will be used instead. The table can be empty. The images parameter can be modified and returned

section.title: darktable.films
section.para: A table containing all the film objects in the database.

section.title: darktable.films.#
section.para: Each film has a numeric entry in the database.

section.title: darktable.films.new
section.para: Creates a new empty film
see darktable.database.import to import a directory with all its images and to add images to a film

listitem.para: The directory that the new film will represent. The directory must exist
The newly created film, or the existing film if the directory is already imported

section.title: darktable.films.delete
section.para: see types.dt_lua_film_t.delete

section.title: darktable.gui
section.para: This subtable contains function and data to manipulate the darktable user interface with Lua.
Most of these function won't do anything if the GUI is not enabled (i.e you are using the command line version darktabl-cli instead of darktable).

section.title: darktable.gui.action_images
section.para: A table of types.dt_lua_image_t on which the user expects UI actions to happen.
It is based on both the hovered image and the selection and is consistent with the way darktable works.
It is recommended to use this table to implement Lua actions rather than dt.gui.hovered or dt.gui.selected to be consistant with darktable's GUI.

section.title: darktable.gui.hovered
section.para: The image under the cursor or nil if no image is hovered.

section.title: darktable.gui.selection
section.para: Allows to change the set of selected images.

listitem.para: A table of images which will define the selected images. If this parameter is not given the selection will be untouched. If an empty table is given the selection will be emptied.
A table containing the selection as it was before the function was called.

section.title: darktable.gui.current_view
section.para: Allows to change the current view.

listitem.para: The view to switch to. If empty the current view is unchanged

section.title: darktable.tags
section.para: Allows access to all existing tags.

section.title: darktable.tags.#
section.para: Each existing tag has a numeric entry in the tags table - use ipairs to iterate over them.

section.title: darktable.tags.create
section.para: Creates a new tag and return it. If the tag exists return the existing tag.

listitem.para: The name of the new tag.

section.title: darktable.tags.find
section.para: Returns the tag object or nil if the tag doesn't exist.

listitem.para: The name of the tag to find.

section.title: darktable.tags.delete
section.para: Deletes the tag object, detaching it from all images.

section.title: darktable.tags.attach
section.para: Attach a tag to an image; the order of the parameters can be reversed.

listitem.para: The image to attach the tag to.

section.title: darktable.tags.detach
section.para: Detach a tag from an image; the order of the parameters can be reversed.

listitem.para: The image to detach the tag from.

section.title: darktable.tags.get_tags
section.para: Gets all tags attached to an image.

listitem.para: The image to get the tags from.
A table of tags that are attached to the image.

section.title: darktable.configuration
section.para: This table regroups values that describe details of the configuration of darktable.

section.title: darktable.configuration.version
section.para: The version number of darktable.

section.title: darktable.configuration.has_gui
section.para: True if darktable has a GUI (launched through the main darktable command, not darktable-cli).

section.title: darktable.configuration.verbose
section.para: True if the Lua logdomain is enabled.

section.title: darktable.configuration.tmp_dir
section.para: The name of the directory where darktable will store temporary files.

section.title: darktable.configuration.config_dir
section.para: The name of the directory where darktable will find its global configuration objects (modules).

section.title: darktable.configuration.cache_dir
section.para: The name of the directory where darktable will store its mipmaps.

section.title: darktable.configuration.api_version_major
section.para: The major version number of the lua API.

section.title: darktable.configuration.api_version_minor
section.para: The minor version number of the lua API.

section.title: darktable.configuration.api_version_patch
section.para: The patch version number of the lua API.

section.title: darktable.configuration.api_version_suffix
section.para: The version suffix of the lua API.

section.title: darktable.configuration.api_version_string
section.para: The version description of the lua API. This is a string compatible with the semantic versionning convention

section.title: darktable.preferences
section.para: Lua allows you do manipulate preferences. Lua has its own namespace for preferences and you can't access nor write normal darktable preferences.

Preference handling functions take a _script_ parameter. This is a string used to avoid name collision in preferences (i.e namespace). Set it to something unique, usually the name of the script handling the preference.

Preference handling functions can't guess the type of a parameter. You must pass the type of the preference you are handling. Allowed values are the following strings
* string * bool * integer * float

section.title: darktable.preferences.register
section.synopsis: function( script : string, name : string, type : string, label : string, tooltip : string, [default : depends on type], [min : int or float], [max : int or float], [step : float] )
section.para: Creates a new preference entry in the Lua tab of the preference screen. If this function is not called the preference can't be set by the user (you can still read and write invisible preferences).

listitem.para: Invisible prefix to guarantee unicity of preferences.
A unique name used with the script part to identify the preference.
The type of the preference - one of the string values described above.
The label displayed in the preference screen.
The tooltip to display in the preference menue.
Default value to use when not set explicitely or by the user.
Minimum value (integer and float preferences only).
Maximum value (integer and float preferences only).
Step of the spinner (float preferences only).

section.title: darktable.preferences.read
section.para: Reads a value from a Lua preference.

listitem.para: Invisible prefix to guarantee unicity of preferences.
The name of the preference displayed in the preference screen.
The type of the preference - one of the string values described above.

section.title: darktable.preferences.write
section.para: Writes a value to a Lua preference.

listitem.para: Invisible prefix to guarantee unicity of preferences.
The name of the preference displayed in the preference screen.
The type of the preference - one of the string values described above.
The value to set the preference to.

section.title: darktable.styles
section.para: This pseudo table allows you to access and manipulate styles.

section.title: darktable.styles.#
section.para: Each existing style has a numeric index; you can iterate them using ipairs.

section.title: darktable.styles.create
section.para: Create a new style based on an image.

listitem.para: The image to create the style from.
The name to give to the new style.
The description of the new style.

section.title: darktable.styles.delete
section.para: Deletes an existing style.

section.title: darktable.styles.duplicate
section.para: Create a new style based on an existing style.

listitem.para: The style to base the new style on.

section.title: darktable.styles.apply
section.para: Apply a style to an image. The order of parameters can be inverted.

listitem.para: The image to apply the style to.

section.title: darktable.styles.import
section.para: Import a style from an external .dtstyle file

section.title: darktable.styles.export
section.para: Export a style to an external .dtstyle file

listitem.para: Is overwriting an existing file allowed

section.title: darktable.database
section.para: Allows to access the database of images. Note that duplicate images (images with the same RAW but different XMP) will appear multiple times with different duplicate indexes. Also note that all images are here. This table is not influenced by any GUI filtering (collections, stars etc...).

section.title: darktable.database.#
section.para: Each image in the database appears with a numerical index; you can interate them using ipairs.

section.title: darktable.database.duplicate
section.para: Creates a duplicate of an image and returns it.

listitem.para: The created image if an image is imported or the toplevel film object if a film was imported.

section.title: darktable.database.import
section.para: Imports new images into the database.

listitem.para:
The filename or directory to import images from.
NOTE: If the images are set to be imported recursively in preferences only the toplevel film is returned (the one whose path was given as a parameter).
NOTE2: If the parameter is a directory the call is non-blocking; the film object will not have the newly imported images yet. Use a post-import-film filtering on that film to react when images are actually imported.

section.title: darktable.database.move_image
section.para: Physically moves an image (and all its duplicates) to another film.
This will move the image file, the related XMP and all XMP for the duplicates to the directory of the new film
Note that the parameter order is not relevant.

section.title: darktable.database.copy_image
section.para: Physically copies an image to another film.
This will copy the image file and the related XMP to the directory of the new film
If there is already a file with the same name as the image file, it wil create a duplicate from that file instead
Note that the parameter order is not relevant.

section.title: darktable.database.delete
section.para: see types.dt_lua_image_t.delete

section.title: darktable.modules
section.para: This table describe the different loadable modules of darktable.

section.title: darktable.modules.format
section.para: Functions to get parameter objects for the different export formats.

section.title: darktable.modules.format.png
section.para: Used to get a new png format object.

listitem.para: A new format object describing the parameters to export to png - initialised to the values contained in the GUI.

section.title: darktable.modules.format.tiff
section.para: see darktable.modules.format.png

section.title: darktable.modules.format.exr
section.para: see darktable.modules.format.png

section.title: darktable.modules.format.copy
section.para: see darktable.modules.format.png

section.title: darktable.modules.format.pfm
section.para: see darktable.modules.format.png

section.title: darktable.modules.format.jpeg
section.para: see darktable.modules.format.png

section.title: darktable.modules.format.ppm
section.para: see darktable.modules.format.png

section.title: darktable.modules.format.webp
section.para: see darktable.modules.format.png

section.title: darktable.modules.format.j2k
section.para: see darktable.modules.format.png

section.title: darktable.modules.storage
section.para:
Functions to get parameter objects for the different export storages.
New values may appear in this table if new storages are registered using Lua.

section.title: darktable.modules.storage.email
section.para: Used to get a new email storage object.

listitem.para: A new storage object describing the parameters to export with - initialised to the values contained in the GUI.

section.title: darktable.modules.storage.latex
section.para: see darktable.modules.storage.email

section.title: darktable.modules.storage.disk
section.para: see darktable.modules.storage.email

section.title: darktable.modules.storage.gallery
section.para: see darktable.modules.storage.email

section.title: darktable.modules.storage.flickr
section.para: see darktable.modules.storage.email

section.title: darktable.modules.storage.facebook
section.para: see darktable.modules.storage.email

section.title: darktable.modules.storage.picasa
section.para: see darktable.modules.storage.email

section.title: darktable.modules.view
section.para: The different views in darktable

section.title: darktable.modules.view.map
section.para: The map view

section.title: darktable.modules.view.map.latitude
section.para: The latitude of the center of the map

section.title: darktable.modules.view.map.longitude
section.para: The longitude of the center of the map

section.title: darktable.modules.view.map.zoom
section.para: The current zoom level of the map

section.title: darktable.modules.view.darkroom
section.para: The darkroom view

section.title: darktable.modules.view.lighttable
section.para: The lighttable view

section.title: darktable.modules.view.tethering
section.para: The tethering view

section.title: darktable.modules.view.slideshow
section.para: The slideshow view

section.title: darktable.modules.lib
section.para: This table allows to reference all lib objects
lib are the graphical blocks within each view.
To quickly figure out what lib is what, you can use the following code which will make a given lib blink.

para.programlisting: local tested_module="global_toolbox" dt.modules.lib[tested_module].visible=false coroutine.yield("wait_ms",2000) while true do dt.modules.lib[tested_module].visible = not dt.modules.lib[tested_module].visible coroutine.yield("wait_ms",2000) end

section.title: darktable.modules.lib.backgroundjobs
section.para: The window displaying the currently running jobs

section.title: darktable.modules.lib.backgroundjobs.create_job
section.para: The window displaying the currently running jobs

listitem.para: The text to display in the job entry
Should a progress bar be displayed
A function called when the cancel button for that job is pressed
note that the job won't be destroyed automatically. You need to set types.dt_lua_backgroundjob_t.valid to false for that
The job who is being cancelded

section.title: darktable.modules.lib.snapshots
section.para: The UI element that manipulates snapshots in darkroom

section.title: darktable.modules.lib.snapshots.ratio
section.para: The place in the screen where the line separating the snapshot is. Between 0 and 1

section.title: darktable.modules.lib.snapshots.direction
section.para:
The direction of the snapshot overlay, can be one of:
top
bottom
left
right

section.title: darktable.modules.lib.snapshots.#
section.para: The different snapshots for the image

section.title: darktable.modules.lib.snapshots.selected
section.para: The currently selected snapshot

section.title: darktable.modules.lib.snapshots.take_snapshot
section.para: Take a snapshot of the current image and add it to the UI
The snapshot file will be generated at the next redraw of the main window

section.title: darktable.modules.lib.snapshots.max_snapshot
section.para: The maximum number of snapshots

section.title: darktable.modules.lib.styles
section.para: The style selection menu

section.title: darktable.modules.lib.metadata_view
section.para: The widget displaying metadata about the current image

section.title: darktable.modules.lib.metadata
section.para: The widget allowing modification of metadata fields on the current image

section.title: darktable.modules.lib.hinter
section.para: The small line of text at the top of the UI showing the number of selected images

section.title: darktable.modules.lib.modulelist
section.para: The window allowing to set modules as visible/hidden/favorite

section.title: darktable.modules.lib.filmstrip
section.para: The filmstrip at the bottom of some views

section.title: darktable.modules.lib.viewswitcher
section.para: The labels allowing to switch view

section.title: darktable.modules.lib.darktable_label
section.para: The darktable logo in the upper left corner

section.title: darktable.modules.lib.tagging
section.para: The tag manipulation UI

section.title: darktable.modules.lib.geotagging
section.para: The geotagging time synchronisation UI

section.title: darktable.modules.lib.recentcollect
section.para: The recent collection UI element

section.title: darktable.modules.lib.global_toolbox
section.para: The common tools to all view (settings, grouping...)

section.title: darktable.modules.lib.filter
section.para: The image-filter menus at the top of the UI

section.title: darktable.modules.lib.import
section.para: The buttons to start importing images

section.title: darktable.modules.lib.ratings
section.para: The starts to set the rating of an image

section.title: darktable.modules.lib.select
section.para: The buttons that allow to quickly change the selection

section.title: darktable.modules.lib.collect
section.para: The collection UI element that allows to filter images by collection

section.title: darktable.modules.lib.colorlabels
section.para: The color buttons that allow to set labels on an image

section.title: darktable.modules.lib.lighttable_mode
section.para: The navigation and zoom level UI in lighttable

section.title: darktable.modules.lib.copy_history
section.para: The UI element that manipulates history

section.title: darktable.modules.lib.image
section.para: The UI element that manipulates the current image

section.title: darktable.modules.lib.modulegroups
section.para: The icons describing the different iop groups

section.title: darktable.modules.lib.module_toolbox
section.para: The tools on the bottom line of the UI (overexposure)

section.title: darktable.modules.lib.session
section.para: The session UI when tethering

section.title: darktable.modules.lib.histogram
section.para: The histogram widget

section.title: darktable.modules.lib.export
section.para: The export menu

section.title: darktable.modules.lib.history
section.para: The history manipulation menu

section.title: darktable.modules.lib.colorpicker
section.para: The colorpicker menu

section.title: darktable.modules.lib.navigation
section.para: The full image preview to allow navigation

section.title: darktable.modules.lib.masks
section.para: The masks window

section.title: darktable.modules.lib.live_view
section.para: The liveview window

section.title: darktable.modules.lib.map_settings
section.para: The map setting window

section.title: darktable.modules.lib.camera
section.para: The camera selection UI

section.title: darktable.modules.lib.location
section.para: The location ui

section.title: darktable.debug
section.para:
This section must be activated separately by calling
require "darktable.debug"

section.title: darktable.debug.dump
section.para:
This will return a string describing everything Lua knows about an object, used to know what an object is.
This function is recursion-safe and can be used to dump _G if needed.

listitem.para: A name to use for the object.
A table of object,string pairs. Any object in that table will not be dumped, the string will be printed instead.
defaults to darktable.debug.known if not set
A string containing a text description of the object - can be very long.

section.title: darktable.debug.debug
section.para: Initialized to false; set it to true to also dump information about metatables.

section.title: darktable.debug.max_depth
section.para: Initialized to 10; The maximum depth to recursively dump content.

section.title: darktable.debug.known
section.para: A table containing the default value of darktable.debug.dump.known

section.title: darktable.debug.type
section.para: Similar to the system function type() but it will return the real type instead of "userdata" for darktable specific objects.

listitem.para: The object whos type must be reported.
A string describing the type of the object.

section.title: types
section.para: This section documents types that are specific to darktable's Lua API.

section.title: types.dt_imageio_module_storage_data_email
section.para: An object containing parameters to export to email.

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t
section.para:
Image objects represent an image in the database. This is slightly different from a file on disk since a file can have multiple developements.
Note that this is the real image object; changing the value of a field will immediately change it in darktable and will be reflected on any copy of that image object you may have kept.

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.attach_tag
section.para: see darktable.tags.attach

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.detach_tag
section.para: see darktable.tags.detach

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.get_tags
section.para: see darktable.tags.get_tags

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.create_style
section.para: see darktable.styles.create

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.apply_style
section.para: see darktable.styles.apply

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.duplicate
section.para: see darktable.database.duplicate

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.move
section.para: see darktable.database.move_image

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.copy
section.para: see darktable.database.copy_image

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.id
section.para: A unique id identifying the image in the database.

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.path
section.para: The file the directory containing the image.

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.film
section.para: The film object that contains this image.

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.filename
section.para: The filename of the image.

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.duplicate_index
section.para: If there are multiple images based on a same file, each will have a unique number, starting from 0.

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.publisher
section.para: The publisher field of the image.

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.title
section.para: The title field of the image.

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.creator
section.para: The creator field of the image.

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.rights
section.para: The rights field of the image.

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.description
section.para: The description field for the image.

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.exif_maker
section.para: The maker exif data.

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.exif_model
section.para: The camera model used.

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.exif_lens
section.para: The id string of the lens used.

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.exif_aperture
section.para: The aperture saved in the exif data.

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.exif_exposure
section.para: The exposure time of the image.

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.exif_focal_length
section.para: The focal length of the image.

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.exif_iso
section.para: The iso used on the image.

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.exif_datetime_taken
section.para: The date and time of the image.

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.exif_focus_distance
section.para: The distance of the subject.

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.exif_crop
section.para: The exif crop data.

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.latitude
section.para: GPS latitude data of the image, nil if not set.

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.longitude
section.para: GPS longitude data of the image, nil if not set.

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.is_raw
section.para: True if the image is a RAW file.

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.is_ldr
section.para: True if the image is a ldr image.

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.is_hdr
section.para: True if the image is a hdr image.

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.width
section.para: The width of the image.

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.height
section.para: The height of the image.

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.rating
section.para: The rating of the image (-1 for rejected).

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.red
section.para: True if the image has the corresponding colorlabel.

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.blue
section.para: see types.dt_lua_image_t.red

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.green
section.para: see types.dt_lua_image_t.red

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.yellow
section.para: see types.dt_lua_image_t.red

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.purple
section.para: see types.dt_lua_image_t.red

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.reset
section.para: Removes all processing from the image, reseting it back to its original state

listitem.para: The image whose history will be deleted

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.delete
section.para: Removes an image from the database

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.group_with
section.para: Puts the first image in the same group as the second image. If no second image is provided the image will be in its own group.

listitem.para: The image whose group must be changed.
The image we want to group with.

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.make_group_leader
section.para: Makes the image the leader of its group.

listitem.para: The image we want as the leader.

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.get_group_members
section.para: Returns a table containing all types.dt_lua_image_t of the group. The group leader is both at a numeric key and at the "leader" special key (so you probably want to use ipairs to iterate through that table).

listitem.para: The image whose group we are querying.
A table of image objects containing all images that are in the same group as the image.

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.group_leader
section.para: The image which is the leader of the group this image is a member of.

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.local_copy
section.para: True if the image has a copy in the local cache

section.title: types.dt_imageio_module_format_t
section.para: A virtual type representing all format types.

section.title: types.dt_imageio_module_format_t.plugin_name
section.para: A unique name for the plugin.

section.title: types.dt_imageio_module_format_t.name
section.para: A human readable name for the plugin.

section.title: types.dt_imageio_module_format_t.extension
section.para: The typical filename extension for that format.

section.title: types.dt_imageio_module_format_t.mime
section.para: The mime type associated with the format.

section.title: types.dt_imageio_module_format_t.max_width
section.para: The max width allowed for the format (0 = unlimited).

section.title: types.dt_imageio_module_format_t.max_height
section.para: The max height allowed for the format (0 = unlimited).

section.title: types.dt_imageio_module_format_t.write_image
section.para: Exports an image to a file. This is a blocking operation that will not return until the image is exported.

listitem.para: The format that will be used to export.

section.title: types.dt_imageio_module_format_data_png
section.para: Type object describing parameters to export to png.

section.title: types.dt_imageio_module_format_data_png.bpp
section.para: The bpp parameter to use when exporting.

section.title: types.dt_imageio_module_format_data_tiff
section.para: Type object describing parameters to export to tiff.

section.title: types.dt_imageio_module_format_data_tiff.bpp
section.para: The bpp parameter to use when exporting.

section.title: types.dt_imageio_module_format_data_exr
section.para: Type object describing parameters to export to exr.

section.title: types.dt_imageio_module_format_data_copy
section.para: Type object describing parameters to export to copy.

section.title: types.dt_imageio_module_format_data_pfm
section.para: Type object describing parameters to export to pfm.

section.title: types.dt_imageio_module_format_data_jpeg
section.para: Type object describing parameters to export to jpeg.

section.title: types.dt_imageio_module_format_data_jpeg.quality
section.para: The quality to use at export time.

section.title: types.dt_imageio_module_format_data_ppm
section.para: Type object describing parameters to export to ppm.

section.title: types.dt_imageio_module_format_data_webp
section.para: Type object describing parameters to export to webp.

section.title: types.dt_imageio_module_format_data_webp.quality
section.para: The quality to use at export time.

section.title: types.dt_imageio_module_format_data_webp.comp_type
section.para: The overall quality to use; can be one of "webp_lossy" or "webp_lossless".

section.title: types.dt_imageio_module_format_data_webp.hint
section.para: A hint on the overall content of the image, can be one of "hint_default", "hint_picture", "hint_photo", "hint_graphic".

section.title: types.dt_imageio_module_format_data_j2k
section.para: Type object describing parameters to export to jpeg2000.

section.title: types.dt_imageio_module_format_data_j2k.quality
section.para: The quality to use at export time.

section.title: types.dt_imageio_module_format_data_j2k.bpp
section.para: The bpp parameter to use when exporting.

section.title: types.dt_imageio_module_format_data_j2k.format
section.para: The format to use can be one of "j2k" or "jp2".

section.title: types.dt_imageio_module_format_data_j2k.preset
section.para: The preset to use can be one of "cinema2k_24", "cinema2k_48", "cinema4k_24".

section.title: types.dt_imageio_module_storage_t
section.para: A virtual type representing all storage types.

section.title: types.dt_imageio_module_storage_t.plugin_name
section.para: A unique name for the plugin.

section.title: types.dt_imageio_module_storage_t.name
section.para: A human readable name for the plugin.

section.title: types.dt_imageio_module_storage_t.width
section.para: The currently selected width for the plugin.

section.title: types.dt_imageio_module_storage_t.height
section.para: The currently selected height for the plugin.

section.title: types.dt_imageio_module_storage_t.recommended_width
section.para: The recommended width for the plugin.

section.title: types.dt_imageio_module_storage_t.recommended_height
section.para: The recommended height for the plugin.

section.title: types.dt_imageio_module_storage_t.supports_format
section.para: Checks if a format is supported by this storage.

listitem.para: The storage type to check against.
True if the format is supported by the storage.

section.title: types.dt_imageio_module_storage_data_flickr
section.para: An object containing parameters to export to flickr.

section.title: types.dt_imageio_module_storage_data_facebook
section.para: An object containing parameters to export to facebook.

section.title: types.dt_imageio_module_storage_data_latex
section.para: An object containing parameters to export to latex.

section.title: types.dt_imageio_module_storage_data_latex.filename
section.para: The filename to export to.

section.title: types.dt_imageio_module_storage_data_latex.title
section.para: The title to use for export.

section.title: types.dt_imageio_module_storage_data_picasa
section.para: An object containing parameters to export to picasa.

section.title: types.dt_imageio_module_storage_data_gallery
section.para: An object containing parameters to export to gallery.

section.title: types.dt_imageio_module_storage_data_gallery.filename
section.para: The filename to export to.

section.title: types.dt_imageio_module_storage_data_gallery.title
section.para: The title to use for export.

section.title: types.dt_imageio_module_storage_data_disk
section.para: An object containing parameters to export to disk.

section.title: types.dt_imageio_module_storage_data_disk.filename
section.para: The filename to export to.

section.title: types.dt_lua_film_t
section.para: A film in darktable; this represents a directory containing imported images.

section.title: types.dt_lua_film_t.move_image
section.para: see darktable.database.move_image

section.title: types.dt_lua_film_t.copy_image
section.para: see darktable.database.copy_image

section.title: types.dt_lua_film_t.#
section.para: The different images within the film.

section.title: types.dt_lua_film_t.id
section.para: A unique numeric id used by this film.

section.title: types.dt_lua_film_t.path
section.para: The path represented by this film.

section.title: types.dt_lua_film_t.delete
section.para: Removes the film from the database.

listitem.para: Force removal, even if the film is not empty.

section.title: types.dt_style_t
section.para: A style that can be applied to an image.

section.title: types.dt_style_t.delete
section.para: see darktable.styles.delete

section.title: types.dt_style_t.duplicate
section.para: see darktable.styles.duplicate

section.title: types.dt_style_t.apply
section.para: see darktable.styles.apply

section.title: types.dt_style_t.export
section.para: see darktable.styles.export

section.title: types.dt_style_t.name
section.para: The name of the style.

section.title: types.dt_style_t.description
section.para: The description of the style.

section.title: types.dt_style_t.#
section.para: The different items that make the style.

section.title: types.dt_style_item_t
section.para: An element that is part of a style.

section.title: types.dt_style_item_t.name
section.para: The name of the style item.

section.title: types.dt_style_item_t.num
section.para: The position of the style item within its style.

section.title: types.dt_lua_tag_t
section.para: A tag that can be attached to an image.

section.title: types.dt_lua_tag_t.delete
section.para: see darktable.tags.delete

section.title: types.dt_lua_tag_t.attach
section.para: see darktable.tags.attach

section.title: types.dt_lua_tag_t.detach
section.para: see darktable.tags.detach

section.title: types.dt_lua_tag_t.name
section.para: The name of the tag.

section.title: types.dt_lua_tag_t.#
section.para: The images that have that tag attached to them.

section.title: types.dt_lib_module_t
section.para: The type of a UI lib

section.title: types.dt_lib_module_t.id
section.para: A unit string identifying the lib

section.title: types.dt_lib_module_t.name
section.para: The translated title of the UI element

section.title: types.dt_lib_module_t.version
section.para: The version of the internal data of this lib

section.title: types.dt_lib_module_t.visible
section.para: Allow to make a lib module completely invisible to the user.
Note that if the module is invisible the user will have no way to restore it without lua

section.title: types.dt_lib_module_t.container
section.para: The location of the lib in the darktable UI

section.title: types.dt_lib_module_t.expandable
section.para: True if the lib can be expanded/retracted

section.title: types.dt_lib_module_t.expanded
section.para: True if the lib is expanded

section.title: types.dt_lib_module_t.position
section.para: A value deciding the position of the lib within its container

section.title: types.dt_lib_module_t.views
section.para: A table of all teh views that display this widget

section.title: types.dt_lib_module_t.reset
section.para: A function to reset the lib to its default values
This function will do nothing if the lib is not visible or can't be reset

section.title: types.dt_lib_module_t.on_screen
section.para: True if the lib is currently visible on the screen

section.title: types.dt_view_t
section.para: A darktable view

section.title: types.dt_view_t.id
section.para: A unique string identifying the view

section.title: types.dt_view_t.name
section.para: The name of the view

section.title: types.dt_lua_backgroundjob_t
section.para: A lua-managed entry in the backgroundjob lib

section.title: types.dt_lua_backgroundjob_t.percent
section.para: The value of the progress bar. nil if there is no progress bar

section.title: types.dt_lua_backgroundjob_t.valid
section.para: True if the job is displayed, set it to false to destroy the entry
An invalid job cannot be made valid again

section.title: types.dt_lua_snapshot_t
section.para: The description of a snapshot in the snapshot lib

section.title: types.dt_lua_snapshot_t.filename
section.para: The filename of an image containing the snapshot

section.title: types.dt_lua_snapshot_t.select
section.para: Activates this snapshot on the display. To deactivate all snapshot you need to call this function on the active snapshot

section.title: types.dt_lua_snapshot_t.name
section.para: The name of the snapshot, as seen in the UI

section.title: events
section.para: This section documents events that can be used to trigger Lua callbacks.

section.title: events.intermediate-export-image
section.para: This event is called each time an image is exported, once for each image after the image has been processed to an image format but before the storage has moved the image to its final destination.

section.title: events.intermediate-export-image.callback
section.synopsis: function( event : string, image : types.dt_lua_image_t, filename : string, format : types.dt_imageio_module_format_t, storage : types.dt_imageio_module_storage_t )

listitem.para: The name of the event that triggered the callback.
The image object that has been exported.
The name of the file that is the result of the image being processed.
The format used to export the image.
The storage used to export the image (can be nil).

section.title: events.intermediate-export-image.extra_registration_parameters
section.para: This event has no extra registration parameters.

section.title: events.post-import-image
section.para:
This event is triggered whenever a new image is imported into the database.
This event can be registered multiple times, all callbacks will be called.

listitem.para: The name of the event that triggered the callback.
The image object that has been exported.

section.title: events.post-import-image.extra_registration_parameters
section.para: This event has no extra registration parameters.

section.title: events.shortcut
section.para:
This event registers a new keyboad shortcut. The shortcut isn't bound to any key until the users does so in the preference panel.
The event is triggered whenever the shortcut is triggered.
This event can only be registered once per value of shortcut.

listitem.para: The name of the event that triggered the callback.
The tooltip string that was given at registration time.
The string that will be displayed on the shortcut preference panel describing the shortcut.

section.title: events.post-import-film
section.para: This event is triggered when an film import is finished (all post-import-image callbacks have already been triggered). This event can be registered multiple times.

listitem.para: The name of the event that triggered the callback.
The new film that has been added. If multiple films were added recursively only the top level film is reported.

section.title: events.post-import-film.extra_registration_parameters
section.para: This event has no extra registration parameters.

section.title: events.view-changed
section.para: This event is triggered after the user changed the active view

listitem.para: The view that we just left
The view we are now in

section.title: events.view-changed.extra_registration_parameters
section.para: This event has no extra registration parameters.

section.title: attributes
section.para: This section documents various attributes used throughout the documentation.

section.title: attributes.write
section.para: This object is a variable that can be written to.

section.title: attributes.read
section.para: This object is a variable that can be read.

section.title: attributes.has_pairs
section.para: This object can be used as an argument to the system function "pairs" and iterated upon.

section.title: attributes.has_ipairs
section.para: This object can be used as an argument to the system function "ipairs" and iterated upon.

section.title: attributes.has_length
section.para: This object has a specific length function that will be used by the # operator.

section.title: attributes.has_tostring
section.para: This object has a specific reimplementation of the "tostring" method that allows pretty-printing it.

section.title: attributes.implicit_yield
section.para: This call will release the Lua lock while executing, thus allowing other Lua callbacks to run.

section.title: attributes.parent
section.para: This object inherits some methods from another object. You can call the methods from the parent on the child object

section.title: system
section.para: This section documents changes to system functions.

section.title: system.coroutine.yield
section.para: Lua functions can yield at any point. The parameters and return types depend on why we want to yield.

listitem.para: The type of yield; can be one of "wait_ms", "file_readable", "run_command".
An extra parameter: integer for "wait_ms", open file for "file_readable", string for "run_command".
Nothing for "wait_ms" and "file_readable"; the returned code of the command for "run_command".
